website_summaries.verdict: A preferred flavor made of top-quality ingredients in a reasonably-priced quantity. Whether they are your dog's favorite treats or you are new to the brand, it's a sound choice.
pros: A popular flavor and a reasonable price for a 1-lb
Made with Zuke's natural, quality ingredients, including chicken seasoned with rosemary and turmeric
A great choice for adult dogs, puppies, and as a training tool
cons: Has the tendency to dry out if the bag isn't closed properly

customer_reviews.title: Unknown sharp object inside treats. Please beware.
customer_reviews.text: Very concerned about this product... wanted to love it as my puppy enjoys them, but after slicing them up to make them smaller for my puppy, we found some objects inside the treats. They are very hard and sharp, kind of like a bone. I’d like to hear back from the company on what these are, as I didn’t find just one, but two!! Other buyers, please be aware, and try slicing these treats up before feeding your pets, for their safety.
customer_reviews.author: Jimin Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great mini treats to avoid overfeeding your dog!
customer_reviews.text: I love giving mini treats to our 10-year-old pug dog, Babu, because we really need to watch his weight. Pug dogs tend to get fat, so understanding what goes into Babu's belly is a must! Each treat is less than 3 calories, so it gives us peace of mind when feeding them to our dog. They are a perfect size for training as well! My favorite part of Zuke's Natural Training Dog Treats is that they are made using real chicken and avoid any artificial colors or flavors. If you're looking for a quality training treat for your dog, I would highly recommend these ones from Zuke's!
customer_reviews.author: J. Ashar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Training Treats!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful! My dog goes absolutely NUTS for these - almost to the point where she won't listen because she's too excited to eat these! They are tiny little bites that are perfect for training. They are each ~3 calories so you can give your pup plenty without worrying about making them chubby. They are corn, wheat and soy-free and have vitamins and minerals. I like that they come in a re-sealable bag for safe keeping. I also like that they're made in the USA - in Durango, CO! I've been giving them to my 13-week old mini Goldendoodle and she hasn't had any stomach issues with these. I would 100% recommend and will certainly order again!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Most dogs at training didn't like the treat
customer_reviews.text: I took it to my first training classes and some people did not know they needed to bring treats so I shared this with them. It was so hard to get our dogs attention because there was limited scent from this product. Most of the dogs also spit the treat out after chewing on it for a bit and didn't want to eat it. At home, my dog loves treats and would rush from anywhere he is to get them. When he smells this (or fail to smell anything), he just turns around and leaves. Edit: It appears the treats also cause my dog to have diarrhea.
customer_reviews.author: Jia Jian Tin

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My dogs are absolutely CRAZY about this stuff. I am very pleased with this product. I've been using it for about 6 months now and my dogs are hooked on it. The only thing I don't like is the way the price has jumped up so high since I first started using it. This was the cheapest seller that I could find so it's not the sellers fault but rather the distributor. The dogs love these treats and look forward to them every evening when we sit down to watch tv. The odor is awful but whatever, as long as my babies are happy & healthy I can deal with that. Thanks for the great product & service.
customer_reviews.author: Cotton

customer_reviews.title: One word:  “DIARRHEA”!
customer_reviews.text: Normally I am more discerning in making a decision to purchase. “My Bad”... My puppy has joined the ranks of those mentioned in the 1 star rating. Abbey loves them but holy smokes! I’m talking about Diarrhea with a. capital “D” !
customer_reviews.author: Zoo Lady

customer_reviews.title: Many hard, sharp objects in every treat!!
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the 1-star reviews but since most people gave high ratings I felt confident and decided to purchase these treats. The person who found sharp objects inside was correct, I also found many tiny, hard, sharp, plastic-like objects inside each treat so I had to throw them out immediately. I wish someone could tell me what they are. I didn't want to risk it with my 3 dogs. I feel very disappointed because I can't get in touch with the supplier and I can't get my money back...
customer_reviews.author: Hana T.

customer_reviews.title: Gave my puppy SEVERE diarrhea with blood
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the salmon. I gave him 4 total treats & he woke up in the middle of the night with bad diarrhea. It persisted throughout the day and had blood & mucus in it. It could be that I just have a really sensitive puppy. It may not be a reflection of the product itself but for me, this is what occurred. I won't give them again and I had to put him on metronidazole and a strong probiotic to stop the diarrhea. He is fine now. That is the only thing I've ever given him besides his food which is chicken based.
customer_reviews.author: Prime❤️er

customer_reviews.title: Dry and Hard
customer_reviews.text: I'm so disappointed. I previously purchased a 6 oz bag of these. They were soft and moist, I could even shove a tiny pill inside. I just bought a 16 oz bag. I opened it, took out a few, and realized they are dry and hard. The bag was well sealed. One of my dogs has no teeth, and a very scarred larynx from a botched debark job long before I rescued him. I would fear for his life if I gave him one of these, he could choke to death.
customer_reviews.author: Diana Liley

customer_reviews.title: Tasty Little Low Cal Treats
customer_reviews.text: These treats may look expensive at first glance, but on comparison of weight they're the biggest bargain. The ingredients are high quality and I feel good about training with them. They are very small (see my photo) so you can feel okay to give them a couple at a time. My dog won't accept treats at the bank or pharmacy drive-thru because he's so spoiled to Zuke's Minis. To be totally transparent, my dad did once work for Zuke's. But I pay full price for them now and this supplier sends them still very soft and fresh. I don't recommend any other great brand.
customer_reviews.author: Strider

customer_reviews.title: Dog Diarrhea Beware
customer_reviews.text: Could not figure out what was giving my dog diarrhea, so we had to cut out treats completely for 2 weeks and slowly add a treat back to his diet. Without fail, Zuke's Mini "Naturals" consistently gave him the runs. Not so sure how "natural" this product is with the way it smells. Sad that I cannot return my extra unopened bag I bought.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Great for clicker training!
customer_reviews.text: We are working on my dog's AKC Intermediate Trick title, and I used chopped up jerky-style treats for his novice. They worked, but I dreaded the mess on my hands and in my pockets while we were training. I was working to eliminate the food reward from the clicker faster than I think is prudent because I hated the feel of the treats. I switched to these because they popped up on Amazon, and I'm thrilled with the texture and feel of them. We reviewed the set of tricks we will be testing next, and I was surprised at how much better the work was because I was was more relaxed as we trained. These are going into permanent rotation!
customer_reviews.author: Teffer

customer_reviews.title: Dog had allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: We bought these to use in our Furbo and while my dog liked the flavor, when we gave her more than a couple during one day her paw got swollen. At first we didn't think of the treats, but then we didn't feed them to her for a month and we started to again, her other paw got swollen. Our dog only eats her dog food and organic treats. That made me check the ingredients on these and even though they advertise them out to be natural ,the ingredients aren't good. Do not buy these, check your dog's treat ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Swan

customer_reviews.title: Rock hard, old. NOT acceptable
customer_reviews.text: I’m super disappointed in the quality of this package. I have ordered these form Amazon before and haven’t had an issue. The treats were hard, dark, and looked old. I couldn’t give them to my dog because of how rock solid they were. I was on a subscription for these and will be canceling after the quality of this package.
customer_reviews.author: KatyT

customer_reviews.title: Spoiled Treats
customer_reviews.text: I these arrived spoiled. I’ve used Zuke’s for two years, since my little baby was a puppy and she loves them. I do too - I love this product. But this seller sent me a spoiled bag, which I didn’t even know was possible with these treats. The smell is horrendous, I couldn’t even open the bag without gagging. I’ve bought an estimated 20 bags in my dog’s lifetime and that’s never happened before. I’ve always bought from a store - never amazon. Just beware what you may be paying for.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Cassels

customer_reviews.title: Gave my poodle diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because it was highly rated. However, my 3 month old poodle never had diarrhea until we got this, and now she gets it even when she has just one or two of these. Will try and return if that's possible.
customer_reviews.author: NOOR

customer_reviews.title: My Pup Won't Eat These...
customer_reviews.text: It is not so much that I hate these (as the star suggests). Obviously, I haven't tasted them. However, my 1-year-old Golden Retriever, who eats EVERYTHING (edible or not), hates these. I don't know why. They are well-recommended. Brady may be a little odd in this regard (as he is in many other regards!). Just be aware that some dogs aren't crazy about them, apparently. It's a pity because these treats fit perfectly in the automatic trainer!
customer_reviews.author: Meg

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic but a bit too soft.
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how to rank the flavor? Haha like heck I’m going to eat these. However the dog hasn’t complained. I did buy the rabbit flavor this time. But the duck flavor has the strongest smell. Which is what you want for puppy training. The smellier the better. And the ingredients seem to be harmless. The size of these are perfect for training. However if your dog chews their food at all—well, these get stuck in my dog’s teeth. Which distracts her away from what I’m using the treats for in the first place. I had to switch to another training treat as these were counterproductive for her.
customer_reviews.author: Kj

customer_reviews.title: They seemed a bit gelatinous when I opened the package (kind of like gummy bears) and she couldn't tolerate them
customer_reviews.text: Zuke's Mini Naturals Chicken Recipe Dog Treats made my one year old dog throw up after giving them to her for a training treat. Two days in a row, two nights of vomiting. Do not give these treats to your pet. They seemed a bit gelatinous when I opened the package (kind of like gummy bears) and she couldn't tolerate them. Nothing in her diet had changed except for the treats. Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Kwould

customer_reviews.title: Dog likes them, but causes soft/runny stool
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are small and stay in one piece well. They had lower calories which is great for training and my dog likes them. My only issue is when I give these, my 9.5 month old Cane Corso's stool is very soft and sometimes runny which indicates she is obviously not digesting them well. I will not be reordering this item and only use them now to stick in the bottom of her Kong to seal the opening before stuffing it-one piece fits perfectly for her smaller light blue one.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Caci

customer_reviews.title: Potty Training Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Flat out puppy crack BUT after two weeks of diarrhea which made potty training flat out miserable. Deficating in cage nightly, he was scream whining because he couldn't control it, we finally narrowed it down to the treats. New treats and in 4 hours diarrhea was gone. Proceed with caution and watch your pups.
customer_reviews.author: simplymeinmo

customer_reviews.title: Bloody diarrhea and vomiting. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Gave our one dog bloody diarrhea/vomiting and cost our other small dog a trip to the ER for an ultrasound. She became very lethargic and stopped eating her food. I checked the ingredients with the vet and there’s cherries in these. Why would the manufacturers put TOXIC ingredients in a treat for dogs? I’m so confused by this. Horrible product. DO NOT BUY.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Owens

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had these treats before through my neighbor. Nothing has ever happened to my dog. First off you’re not gonna believe this the package came cut in half. Yes you read that right. It looks like somebody took the package, took a pair scissors and cut the top off. It was completely open and treats were all over the envelope. Unacceptable.Amazon is going to send me a new package. Hopefully that will be OK. Terrible quality control.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Okay treat but best for training
customer_reviews.text: I get the feeling that a dog wants to chow down on something substantial when it gets a treat. Not with these pellets that are a bit bigger than a Bayer aspirin. I don't train dogs but I imagine that using these for training works well so I think that this is a good product, just not for my thinking about giving a dog a hunk of something for a treat (like a doggy jerky treat). I think that if I was a dog getting these treats, I would be doing anything the trainer wanted over and over again to keep getting these tiny bits of treat. They would never satisfy my 24/7 hunger for anything to eat.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats. Made out of quality ingredients
customer_reviews.author: Gunjan

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! Except now kibble is trash
customer_reviews.text: These might work too good! haha. My super young Golden Retriever LOVES this. She'll do every trick in the book to get some. So much so i have to be careful when I give her these treats or she'll reject her regular kibble dog food as training treats. Definitely recommend. Keep them in a tight sealed bag (ziplock) if you put them in a training pouch, or they can go dry and be crumbly. Also, yes they are tiny, but because they are moist I still break them in half for my pup, not because she can't eat the whole thing, but because I want her to not eat too much of this and miss her regular diet of food.
customer_reviews.author: J. Motta

customer_reviews.title: ZUKES!
customer_reviews.text: These are hands down the best treats I have tried, they are the perfect size and have attracted my pickiest dog. While they do have an odor I don't find it bothersome, yet this will vary. Training is always fun with these and I can use them freely since they are low cal. I have yet to find a flavor my pups don't like and that is also a bonus. Can't go wrong with Zuke's, will certainly buy more down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Damaged product packaging
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product several times without problem and the dogs love it. However, today's order was received inside a plastic bag and the mailing package. Neither of those items were damaged and it was the first time I think I received the Zuke bag inside a plastic bag. When I took the Zuke's bag out of the plastic bag the treats fell out across a dirty floor. There was a large slit in the Zuke's bag only. So essentially I am getting only a half a bag for the price of a whole bag.
customer_reviews.author: Arkiepoo

customer_reviews.title: My picky dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased several treat options lately trying to find one my dogs truly like. I needed a treat to reward them, and also for when they need to kennel up (I want them to look forward to going in, and a treat does the trick). I researched vet recommended treats- I wasn't happy with the treats we previously had, even tho my dogs did like them. This is the FIRST of all we’ve tried they really like. And since they are super tiny (even for my little chi/yorkie pups) i can give them several throughout the day for rewards.
customer_reviews.author: Stephaniek219

customer_reviews.title: This keeps my Lab trim and happy.
customer_reviews.text: We have a 7 year old Lab that would everything in sight if he could get away with it. We noticed that he had gained a few extra pounds and began to have knee problems. We are so happy we found these treats. They aren't very caloric, and he feels like he gets lots of rewards. We tried other training treats and found this one had less powder left over in the package. It is not fun reaching into a treat bag and pulling each little training treat out of a glob of sticky goo and fluffy powder. He likes all the flavors.
customer_reviews.author: Stargazer8

customer_reviews.title: Zukes chicken treat minis
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered this item before and I never had a problem with it. This last time it seems to have gone bad and it was moldy which never happened before: maybe it was an old batch? It was stored in the pouch but it didn’t last and I could not return it as the return date passed. Very disappointed as my dog loves these treats
customer_reviews.author: Donna Santiago

customer_reviews.title: A bit too soft for what I was looking for... which could be good or bad.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these before and they were the perfect treats to keep in your pocket while training dogs. This batch was more soft and mushy than the others were and don't work as good in your pocket. It might be fine for a treat pouch as many use and you might prefer how fresh it is, but for my purpose it wasn't ideal. The ingredients are good and the dog(s) like the flavor though.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Love the small size (and low calories). Great for training rewards.
customer_reviews.text: As a new dog parent to a young puppy, training has been at the forefront. My pup (like most) is very food motivated and therefore food is a great training reward. But I am worried about overfeeding and many treats come in large pieces. These Zuke's minis come in small / low calorie pieces, there's quite a large variety of flavors, and most importantly puppy loves them.
customer_reviews.author: Pablo

customer_reviews.title: because they smell so good that I tried them
customer_reviews.text: Delicious. I know, because they smell so good that I tried them. They're a little sweet from the carroty flavor and taste a bit like stew. The dog loves them too ;) She was so eager for them during training the first time that she didn't chew them before swallowing and threw up a little while later. The vomit smelled good. I learned my lesson though. I hand them out more slowly and wait for her to chew them now and there have been no further accidents of that sort even though I still use the treats frequently. No other ill effects to either of us (I still have one now and then) two months later.
customer_reviews.author: Brett Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Nice Training Treat
customer_reviews.text: Great training treat. I have been using these to train my medium/large aussiedoodle. They are the perfect size and he is very motivated by their smell. They have a strong (in a good way) fresh smell. He always knows when I have them and gives me his complete attention. The size is perfect for training - you can use quite a few without feeling like your overfeeding your dog. I just bought my third bag. I have tried the salmon and chicken versions - I was worried the salmon one would smell fishy but it didn't. Great treats!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: My dog LOVES these!
customer_reviews.text: My German Shepherd Dog looooooves these things! She has a bit of a sensitive stomach (not uncommon for GSDs) and she has no issues with these. They make wonderful training treats and the are so soft when they come out of the bag. They do get hard after being out for a while (I have treats in all of my pockets and have to frisk myself before doing the laundry), but my Koda doesn't seem to mind that at all! Also, if they do happen to go through the laundry they don't stain or squish into your clothes (thank goodness!). This is also the best price I have found, both online and locally!
customer_reviews.author: PythiaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Different Flavors received
customer_reviews.text: I actually sent this to a friend, instead of my address. The flavors were different, peanut butter, chicken and another flavor. Since I was visiting my friend I gave her these treats. Her dog enjoyed them. I reordered and got what I ask for so didn't have to worry about the chicken allergy. for if this had come to my home I would have had to return it. I'm ready to reorder my dogs love these and I think it's a health snack, I hope I get the right ones!
customer_reviews.author: sheril kay miller

customer_reviews.title: The salmon is super stinky and my dog absolutely loves them
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of training with my dog, teaching her silly tricks to amuse myself during the pandemic. She will do anything to get one of these salmon treats. A trainer that we worked with when she was a puppy told us that stinky treats work best and he was right. If the bag is zip locked closed, there is no odor. I highly recommend these and will definitely buy them again as they really are not grossly stinky just enticing for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Expired bag
customer_reviews.text: Got this bag a few months ago (April) and my dog seemed really excited when she saw the bag, I gave her a little bit and she seemed to like it, about 8 minutes later she started to vomit, I was worried so I looked over at the bag and apparently they sent me an already expired bag (February) kinda disappointing, I should have looked but I wasn’t expecting to get a bag over a month bad :/ luckily my dog was alright and she stopped vomiting the same day
customer_reviews.author: Anahi Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Why are they hard? Should be soft.
customer_reviews.text: Hard! I saw other reviews and avoided getting this on Amazon for awhile. Recently decided to try and they are hard. When I buy these at the pet store they are soft. Why the difference? Low stars for freshness and quality. Outside of this purchase at Amazon, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: Angelysty

customer_reviews.title: She learns so much quicker with this treat!!
customer_reviews.text: I was using typical dog milk bones to train my rescued dog and it was taking a lot longer time for her to learn one trick. I researched about training treat and saw this one in Amazon. I decided to buy two different flavors and oh, boy, she loves them! Now, she really tries hard for this treat! Size of treat is perfect since you don't want to give your dog a large sized treat for training purpose. Every time I am about to open a bag, she already knows it is time for training and she comes and sit down by me. What a big difference it made! I will buy them again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gave my dog diarrhoea
customer_reviews.text: Gave my dog (with a cast iron stomach) diarrhoea for the first time in his life and poisonous gas. Bought to go in our Furbo, they work great in it by the way, just don’t appreciate stepping in the squirts when I got home.
customer_reviews.author: goats run southTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great Reward Treat
customer_reviews.text: These treats are wonderful, because they are small and the dogs love them. They are small enough to use as a reward for training - you can even cut them into 1/4 to make them last for small dogs. My dogs will learn any trick with these treats. All I have to do is hold up the bag when they are in the yard and they come running. They come in a ziplock style bag to keep them fresh and you will want to make sure and seal them each time because they will dry out otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen F

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: We love these for our 11 week old golden doodle puppy! Just had to leave a review how great they are. Might be a little long because all the great reason we like these treats! They’re so soft which our puppy appreciates and small enough for her! She works so hard during potty training/obedience training because she really likes these treats. We got the duck and rabbit flavor, haven’t tried the duck but she’s obsessed with the rabbit ones. We were looking for a healthy, low calorie, affordable training treat and found exactly what we’re looking for. I’m writing this review only after a couple days of using them so hopefully health wise her body likes them too!
customer_reviews.author: Marquardt

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these things, they break up nicely to make smaller treats
customer_reviews.text: What I like best about these is that they're firm enough to stay whole in my pocket, but also soft enough that I can break each small treat into 4 or 5 portions, so I can have my dog do multiple tricks with just one treat. She's only ten pounds, so I have to watch how much I give her -- these work great for that. The bag seals really well too -- noticeably well, compared to other zipper bags. Nice quantity of treats too. Overall, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: HalfGeek

customer_reviews.title: My goldendoodle loves them but my nose doesn't
customer_reviews.text: My dog really likes these training treats. She is very picky so I'm glad she likes them. My main problem is my own sensitivity to smell. They have such a strong odor. The moment I open the bag I have to turn away. My boyfriend can be in another room and he'll mmediately know I opened them. He dislikes the "nasal discomfort" also, but handles it better than me. I'm still going to continue purchasing since my dog loves them
customer_reviews.author: JTay

customer_reviews.title: My Belgian Malinois Loves Them - Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for training. Awesome ingredients. And, my Belgian Malinois loves them, making training him even easier. He'll do anything for these. They are the perfect training size, equivalent to a large pea. I put a handful in an empty resealable candy bag, and use a binder clip to attach them to the waist of my jeans or shorts, for training and walks. He loves them so much that just the sound of the bag, when I'm reaching for them, keeps him focused. The price is unbeatable, especially for the quality. And, they are made in the USA! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Tessa B.

customer_reviews.title: My go-to training treat
customer_reviews.text: I have two rescue dogs and these small treats are the best way to have positive reinforcement and training without filling your dog up on calorie laden treats that are large and are cookie like. We wanted a meat treat that would help with encouragement and it does the trick. I have a 35LB hound mix and a 50LB German Shepherd, and it works on both of them like a charm, this will probably be the only company I buy from in terms of treats.
customer_reviews.author: KitchenWitch

customer_reviews.title: Puppy likes them
customer_reviews.text: I have an 8 week old beagle and the size is a little big for him. We bought the salmon flavor and the smell really bad but that’s expected since it’s a fishy flavor. I tried to feed my puppy one but he was not interested until I cut them into tiny pieces and fed one at a time. I wish I didn’t have to break them apart because my hand smells afterward but they really are great training treats.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy of 3

customer_reviews.title: Love Zukes
customer_reviews.text: Gave them three stars because they are zukes and we could use them but two bags were both quite dry. Our little dog was not impressed. Picked up a bag at my local pet store and they were moist and smelled great. I guess it’s a roll of the dice.
customer_reviews.author: Foxglove

customer_reviews.title: So good I treat myself
customer_reviews.text: So these random pieces people have found is not plastic. It’s cartilage. I know because I wasn’t a snowflake like these two and chewed on it myself. If you are gonna feed your dog something and question it, then buck up and test it yourself. I eat everything outside of bone when I eat meat. Cartridge is good for you so, I am quite familiar with the texture and hard crunch.
customer_reviews.author: Prime4Life

customer_reviews.title: Fave!
customer_reviews.text: These are her favorite and my favorite! Tried the peanut butter first and quickly realized my weirdo dog doesnt like anything PB flavored, got the chicken next and she LOVES THEM big time. And I love them because the are easy to break apart -they don't crumble or leave a messy residue on your hands, they are perfect for training! Looking forward to trying more flavors. Smell fine too.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Ann

customer_reviews.title: Great deal my dogs go nuts for them
customer_reviews.text: Well I can't vouch for the flavor myself but my dogs go nuts over these! It's hard to motivate small dogs to learn new things without the use of some edible and you don't want them gaining weight. These are the perfect size! I used to use cheerios as reward but since I've been using these treats, they don't look at cheerios the same. It's nice because they have a resealable pouch so they don't go stale. And since I don't use them every day they last quite a while so it's a good deal for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Olive's OpinionsTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Perfect treats for training our puppy!
customer_reviews.text: We've tried other treats while training our golden doodle puppy, but these seem to be the best quality. They are fresh and moist, and easy to use on the go when we are taking a walk and want to reward our pup for not eating the dead bird he somehow found on the road or other junk along the way! The treats are the perfect size for training, and he doesn't have to stop to chew them like other harder ones. I just wish they were sold in Walmart or other places.
customer_reviews.author: Anne F.

customer_reviews.title: Third time buying this!
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves this - he's a bit smaller (~ 12 lbs) so some of the bigger sized treats don't work. He loves doing tricks for them. -1 star because I saw these in store and they're a bit cheaper in store but...Amazon is convenient so I guess I'm paying extra for convenience? Pic of my pupster attached - he's not doing treats, he got tired from walking in the heat so I had to carry him home :3
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Dogs gave it an A+
customer_reviews.text: The grand dogs adored! Love the tiny size and healthy salmon flavor. Did not try it myself but the mutts approved. It was jump-off-the-floor great to them! Little pricey for the small bag but they loved!
customer_reviews.author: JA

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them, but the smell remains
customer_reviews.text: I was of the thinking that since I have a larger dog I need larger treats. It turns out that small treats are perfectly fine since it is the act of being rewarded that helps in training. Our dog loves these treats and they are much easier than the other ones we use, since we cut those in half to get smaller treats. The only negative I see so far is that even after washing my hands they still smell like the treats. I'm still going to use them, but I might need some stronger soap, or gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these.
customer_reviews.text: I like that these are not those hard cracker type biscuits. These mini's are moist, and my dog gets one after each big fetch if she puts the ball in my hand. She is a fetching pro now, and I do not have to worry about junk ingredients that are dried out. I will keep buying Do not think they are big, they are very mini. But good rewards in training.
customer_reviews.author: K R TTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: They Changed Peanut Butter Recipe!
customer_reviews.text: These were my dog’s favorite treat. She ate them for years. The last package she refuses to eat. They’re even lighter in color. She acts so disappointed. I tested it out, and I gave her one from this package, and one from a previous package. She ate the one that was darker, from the previous package. They have changed the recipe, and our little Shih Zu knows it!
customer_reviews.author: Mugs

customer_reviews.title: Both dogs refuse to eat them--complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I have two dogs, one is a fussy eater for a dog, and the other is the usual eat anything dog. They both spit these things out and wanted nothing to do with them. I got the duck version because both dogs "wolf" down duck strip treats. Maybe this is a bad lot but I feel I got rooked. They have a very strong odor.
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Great for small dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these as training treats. I cut them up into 4 pieces with a knife for my 8 lb puppy so that I do not overfeed her and can use a lot for training. The texture/consistency is perfect for cutting up because it is not too crumbly and still stays moist after being cut (as long as you put them in Tupperware or something. They will dry up if you leave them out, which is not as attractive to my dog because she can't smell them.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Awesome that they have them in bulk!
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of training treats since my dog is a puppy, so I'm glad that there's a bulk option available. The one downside is that these are a little bit dryer/tougher than the treats I normally get, and they didn't have quite as nice a scent. (I really like that smokey scent a lot of treats have. Maybe I'll have to get the bacon scent instead next time!) But my dog seems to like them! So that's what matters.
customer_reviews.author: Fio

customer_reviews.title: My hounds were not impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I got the salmon version of these and I was super excited to give them to my dogs. First, these treats smell awful! 2nd, both my hound mixes turned their noses at them. Wouldn't even take them out of my hand. One of my dogs pushed my hand aside with her nose. I tried giving them one later and they still wouldn't take them. So I'm stuck with a full bag of opened treats that my dogs won't eat. I do love the size of the treats for training purposes and how many you get for the price. Maybe I just picked the wrong flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole PerrellTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog sick.
customer_reviews.text: What the heck is my dog going to write the review? Rate flavor?!? Well I guess he did. Every time I give him more than 1 per day he has diarrhea. So Cooper the Doberman gives you 1 Star for Taco Bell style explosive poop.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher P. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Terrific dog training treats
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic! They have made it so much easier to train our strong minded Beagle puppy. This is the fourth Training treat we have tried. She liked them all, but LOVES these. Since we starting using these training treats, she is so much more willing to work with us because she wants the treat. We just have to make sure we seal them up because we found our cat with her head in the bag eating as many as she could. Plus when I’m working on training the puppy, the cats come running and start screaming for a couple treats, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bella

customer_reviews.title: Made my dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: My dogs did seem to really enjoy these, but after a couple of days two of them started getting sick after eating them. The only thing in their diet that changed was these treats, we stopped giving them and our boys are feeling much better. Just be cautious and monitor your dogs closely after giving these.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Adams

customer_reviews.title: Not Fresh For Long
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats. I generally get the smaller bag so they won't have a chance to get stale. But this time I decided to order the larger bag, and wouldn't you know- the bag won't seal! There is no way he can eat all the treats before the become as hard as rocks. A product is only as good as the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little training treat
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to training treat. I've been using them for some time. To me, they're the perfect size--about the size of a pencil eraser. One gulp's worth! Very convenient. They arrive moist, thought they will dry out if you leave the bag open. They don't get quite the response that something like freeze-dried liver would get, but both of my dogs like them.
customer_reviews.author: AJP

customer_reviews.title: My dog doesn't like it.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this stuff for training a very large (86 pound) Lab that is 11 months old. The pellets are so small that half of the time they fall out of his mouth and he doesn't even notice. That can't say much for the flavor. When I pinch one between my fingers it has the consistency of wet wood fibers. More than once I've tried to give him a reward only to have him turn his back on them. I switched over to Happy Howies Turkey roll (diced up into small cubes) and he looks for ways to earn another reward.
customer_reviews.author: Holescreek

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE these!
customer_reviews.text: Great treats, nice peanut butter aroma - smells fresh and wholesome. They are small enough to be used for training, but great for regular treats, too, especially if you're trying to keep your dog's weight down - the small size keeps us from over-loving our dogs. :) No tummy upsets (both dogs have very sensitive stomachs), and our little one who has pancreatitis has had no bad reaction to them (but again, we do NOT over do it with these). Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: coffee&books

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and my dogs love them
customer_reviews.text: I have whippets, which are supposed to stay reasonably skinny, but who can gain weight pretty quickly with a lot of snacking. I like the small size of these treats. The dogs love them, but don't get filled up if they get a few treats each day. Some dog treats are so big that they're practically a whole meal for a smaller dog. I'm glad I found these. I do think they're a bit overpriced.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: Made my dogs sick
customer_reviews.text: Okay so these treats, my dogs loved, however they made them both very sick. My dogs kept throwing these up. This isn't normal for my dogs, and my vet recommend I stopped the treats.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves these!
customer_reviews.text: She knows when I open the bag to her treats and she gets very excited. She seems to love the Zuke's taste and have never turned her nose up or gotten bored with them. I do alternate flavors when I finish a bag but I feel good about feeding her these. They are low on calories and small enough already that I don't feel like I have to break them up or portion them out to her.
customer_reviews.author: SleepingKnight

customer_reviews.title: Doggie approved and good for training
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love these. I’ve been using them to train my 8 month old beagle and they do the trick. My dogs love the flavor and the ingredients are decent. They’re very soft at first but they do harden to the consistency of a slim Jim if you leave the bag open. I carry some around a ziplock bag and use them whenever I need to reward my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Masis

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves them, perfect for treat thrower
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these! I use them with Furbo treat cam and they are perfect size, throws out a few at a time. They are around 2.5 cals each and my dog is allowed up to 100 cals per day from treats so these are perfect for training.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: DOGS MAY BECOME ADDICTED!
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these. If I run out of these I may be locked out of the house by the dog. The begging is unbelievable, he can hear the bag opening at 50 ft away. I put them into his toys and he attacks the toys till their all gone. Please never stop making them. I won't know what to do if the Zukes company stops production. I will be permanently in the dog house ! P.S. I haven't told them their low calorie.
customer_reviews.author: DIANE

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Training Treat!
customer_reviews.text: I started buying these treats, when my puppy and I were going through obedience classes. We were supposed to bring "pea sized" treats to class to reward the pups. This treat is the perfect size. They are small enough they I didn't feel bad about giving my pup several of them during class. Better yet, these treats didn't give my dog gas like some other brands did. Six months later, we still use these treats on a regular basis. We have several other dogs in the family as well and they all love them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah AndersonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Gives diarrhea to your dog
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what is wrong with it but it gives both of my dogs diarrhea and vomiting. I just got it and it supposed to be good till may 2022.
customer_reviews.author: kiba

customer_reviews.title: Pebble treats
customer_reviews.text: Because of other reviewers comments on big bag having dry treats and hard, I ordered a small bag. Didn't matter. They are so dry and hard, my puppy can't eat them. She gets frustrated and leaves it on the floor...now she doesn't even bother to take them anymore; she just turns and walks away. They have the consistency of a rock! Very disappointed cuz the ingredients seem good.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a flavor and get these
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these and they work perfect for training. I don’t want to give my dog large treats while training and these fit the bill. My German Shepard almost only wants these treats now exclusively. I did a bunch of searching for good training treats and these came up on several lists. Very happy with them. So much so, that I decided to subscribe and save them. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Courson

customer_reviews.title: I wish she liked it
customer_reviews.text: I read all of the positive reviews and ordered this for my labradoodle puppy, but she hates them. She will literally put it in her mouth and then spit back on the floor. This is a first. She is very food motivated. Happy it worked for others.
customer_reviews.author: Timica

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Delivery was very slow
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love this product. I have a German Shepherd puppy and she is training so well with these treats. I wish they came sooner in her training when I first got her. My older dog who thinks he doesn't think he has to learn new tricks because he has it like that is willing to go the extra mile to earn a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Peanut-butter obsessed dog didn't like these
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE - 4/24/17 My dog actually loved these after a little coaxing, and we went through the bag pretty quick with training sessions. I even bought another bag of the peanut butter, and a bag of the chicken flavored treats as well. Awesome! -------Original Review----- The treats seemed like good quality, but my dog didn't care for them (and she LOVES peanut butter or anything peanut butter flavored), so I have to wonder if it's the texture or some of the ingredients that she doesn't like. I now have a huge bag full of these that will go to waste unless I can find another dog that likes them! Fingers crossed.
customer_reviews.author: NolaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Will make your puppy go potty every hour
customer_reviews.text: My dog got diarrhea type symptoms after taking this treat. Poor guy would squat and try poop for minutes but only few drops would come out. To be fair I did try and stick with it for 3 weeks and I also try and keep the treat in the freezer but nothing helped. He got better as soon as I stopped giving him this treat
customer_reviews.author: Puneet Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for Training Treats
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure what is wrong with these treats. We purchased the Chicken flavor and although my Dog really likes them, after 2 or 3 treats, the treats get stuck in the back of her mouth. I will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Like Crack for Dogs
customer_reviews.text: My dogs will do almost anything for these treats. I got them to help train my stubborn dachshund. All I have to do is open the treat bag, and I immediately have his attention and the attention of myJack Russell mix. They are training treats, so they are very small. The size is a plus as I don’t have to worry about over feeding the dogs while training them.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl Lanham

customer_reviews.title: Duck treats
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves these treats!! We bought a teaching patients game where you hide the treats in and they have to figure out how to pull the levers and move the sliders to get the treats out. He did well and now is a pro. This is the first duck treat I bought him and he gets excited whenever we open the bag. I would recommend these treats for training your dog because there little enough and if you have a large dog like me, they can eat a lot of them during training and since there so little, they will do anything to get more, lol.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Great Product and Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: These are the best training treats I have found. There are globs of them in the bag and I am not afraid to pass out a dozen or more a day for my puppy to reward her when she does good. Since they are soft there is no need to take a break in the training to let her chew a hard treat or choke on it is she tries to gulp it down. She has advanced in two weeks with these more than a month using other treats. I love the fact that she finally "gets it" that good behavior equals a treat and she looks at my pocket and waits for her reward.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgiaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Attack of the hounds!
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic treats! My dogs attack me as soon as I walk through the door. Hoots and hollers and Woo Woos! are heard as I walk towards the door. They can't get enough of these and if I don't respond to their request fast enough, one of my dogs gets a bone and hurls it excitedly towards my feet as payment for a treat from our "cookie" jar. So far they have liked the peanut butter, chicken and the super foods veggie flavors. One of my dogs has a very sensitive stomach and these do not affect her delicate digestive tract at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: My puppy pug will do anything for the Peanut Butter treats
customer_reviews.text: We had some other treats and were trying to train our new pug. She was not interested at all. She preferred just positive reinforcement. Then I got the peanut butter treats from Zuke's and now she looks for chances to obey or do a trick to get one. In less than a week, she sits on command, comes when called and heels when on a walk just from desire to get one of these treats. Also, she tends toward diarrhea issues and these don't bother her tummy at all. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: D. Lawless

customer_reviews.title: Three different breed toy dogs not finicky....WONT EAT
customer_reviews.text: I have three little dogs that eat dry kibble. They are toy poodle, chihuahua, and chorkie and eat other kinds of treats. None of them will eat these even if I crush them so they can smell. The best I can get is for them to carry them away but never will any of my dogs eat them. I like the size of treat and packaging but sadly will give them away and consider this a bust. I got the chicken recipe and yes they like chicken.
customer_reviews.author: coffee drinker

customer_reviews.title: 38% PRICE INCREASE
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying Zuke's Mini Chicken Dog Treats for a couple of years. Great product! Dog loves them. Relatively healthy treats for my Border Collie. Paid $10.06 recently [about July 2019]. Was going to reorder today and found price to be $13.99, a whopping increase of $3.93. This is a 38% increase. In view of very large price hike, I will NOT buy this [Zuke's] product again. Will search of alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Sam (Portland, OR)

customer_reviews.title: Every Flavor is a winner!
customer_reviews.text: We use these treats while we train our beagle puppy. She's absolutely in love with every flavor. They are the perfect size for training and very low in calories. The ingredients and variety are what initially drew us to try this product. After having tried a few other brands of similar type treats, these Zukes take the cake!!
customer_reviews.author: Keith S.

customer_reviews.title: Label says it contains no wheat, but...
customer_reviews.text: the ingredients list says it does contain barley so beware! If you have celiac or a strong sensitivity to wheat you almost certainly don't want to be touching barley either. My dog likes these treats and I've found them to be a good size for treat dispensers but I wash my hands really well after touching them to avoid accidental gluten exposure.
customer_reviews.author: K Willett

customer_reviews.title: Zuke's is the one!
customer_reviews.text: Our little dog, Henry, is a pretty picky eater. Won't eat dog food, so we make his food, and he only liked chicken-wrapped yams for treats which were made out-of-country. But, friends sent him a bag of Zuke's (chicken flavor), and he loves them! He tells us when he wants them, and then is eager to dance and wave between each morsel, and we don't even ask that of him! And, we like the fact that they're natural, and made in the U.S. We'll stick with Zuke's!
customer_reviews.author: oldandrusty

customer_reviews.title: So good that it's ruined my dog.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't quite understand the dialect my dog used when I questioned him about his treats. However, this little dude will only eat these treats. Seriously, it's annoying. I think he gives Zukes training treats 10 stars. He spits other brands out. I can't leave the house unless I give him these treats and have to keep a surplus so I don't run out. My dog has turned into a monster. What is in these things?!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Chihuahua approved!
customer_reviews.text: The Zuke Mini has become a staple of my dog’s life. They’re small enough to give my dog regularly without worrying about him getting chubby and they are flavorful enough for training. So, far he has not shown any boredom and has never refused a treat. I will highly recommend them, especially for small pups.
customer_reviews.author: Insomniak1

customer_reviews.title: Our Yellow Lab Loves Them
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dog treat we have found to date. Our 10 month old Yellow Lab loves them. We use the treats just for training and fetch the ball. The quality seems exceptional and the price isn't unreasonable for the amount provided. What I really like is that the smaller size (a little bigger than a pea) let's me reward her more often with less food, that's important especially given this Lab's unending appetite. Although I ordered the Peanut Butter and Chicken treats I haven't tried them yet, but if they're anything like the Salmon they'll be a hit. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Hog Driver

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Treat!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what an amazing surprise in such a small package! I was given a tiny sample size package of the chicken flavor at the local chain pet shop and after much hesitation (because I limit what my dog's eat), I finally sprinkled some on top of their dog food one day to entice my larger dog to eat. My dog's love these and they never seem to get enough. I especially like these are not unhealthy treats and they are made naturally with my dog's health and well-being in mind. I have since purchased both the rabbit flavor and the chicken flavor in the largest size I can afford.
customer_reviews.author: DanaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING TREATS
customer_reviews.text: My puppy absolutely loves these treats. I got the flavor Peanut Butter and Oats. They are very soft, so I can break them into smaller pieces and get more out of them. In addition, the packaging is awesome! Keeps the treats fresh for a long time! I read the ingredients and I was blown away! I mean, Peanut Butter was the FIRST ingredient! No wonder my dog loves them! All very wholesome and vegetarian
customer_reviews.author: Raman Joshi

product_meta.title: Zuke's Naturals Training and NEW! Soft Chewy Calming Dog Treats
product_meta.description: Style:Mini Naturals| Flavor Name:Chicken| Size:16 oz. PouchZuke's Mini Naturals Chicken Recipe Training Dog Treats lead the adventure of training with your dog. With the right reward, you can keep every moment of the journey healthy and deliciously fun. Crafted using the Earth's best ingredients, these mini dog treats are made with real chicken as the first ingredient, plus real whole foods like berries and savory herbs. These training treats are crafted with vitamins and minerals and NO corn, wheat or soy. At less than 3 calories per treat, Zuke's Mini Naturals soft dog treats are the perfect size to use as a guilt free reward for your dog. Every pouch of these soft and chewy dog treats reseals for convenient, on-the-go rewards. Live life off the leash with these trail-tested, chicken dog treats.
feature_bullets: Wholesome, tender mini bites for all your adventures in training
Less than 3 calories per treat for guilt free rewarding
Healthy dog treats made with natural ingredients like real chicken and whole food berries
One (1) 16.0 oz Bag - Zuke's Mini Naturals Training Dog Treats Chicken Recipe

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
